requirements.description:
The ACCC requires services to conduct a number (up to six) penetration tests, each comprising:

  • Testing one, or a combination, of components of the ACCC’s Azure cloud infrastructure, databases, network devices, portal and websites
  • Development of a penetration test plan (in conjunction with the ACCC IT teams)
  • Execution of the agreed plan
  • Report detailing the test results and associated recommendations.


This will involve the following document deliverables to the ACCC for each test:

  • Penetration Test Plan – detailing the agreed test approach and scope. The plan is to specifically address the:
    • Planned sequence of test activities and associated timeframes,
    • Toolsets to be employed (together with any requirement for software to be installed on ACCC or third-party infrastructure),
    • Dependencies (including those relating to ACCC or third-party involvement), and
    • Resource requirements (resourcing as well as any ACCC resources or third-party required to support the testing effort).
  • Penetration Test Report – detailing the results of the planned testing program and including an assessment of these results which addresses:
    • Areas of system tested and not tested;
    • the vulnerabilities identified and the nature and extent of the associated risk, and
    • recommendations for treating the vulnerabilities and risks identified.

requirements.description:
The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission (ACIC) is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Program / Project Manager to support a number of current and upcoming ACIC ICT projects.

The expected roles and responsibilities are to:

  • Lead and manage ICT project(s) or a program of work which contribute to the ACIC’s strategic outcomes and objectives, in accordance with corporate standards for project management and ensure projects integrate with the ACIC’s business.
  • Document and manage the start-up, initiation, delivery and closure of projects in accordance with corporate project management standards, which are based upon PRINCE2.
  • Develop and/or update Business Cases for large and complex ICT projects.
  • Develop and maintain an accurate project schedule and deliver products according to the schedule.
  • Develop and maintain the project budget, and track costs and expenditure to deliver the project within tolerances.
  • Manage scope, quality, risk and issue management processes to ensure outcomes are delivered.
  • Identify, acquire and manage project staff and provide effective direction and leadership to the project team.
  • Engage with an extensive array of stakeholders on any given project. The role is required to initiate, establish and maintain strong relationships with: (1) Internal stakeholders to ensure access to resources and alignment with other interrelated projects; and (2) External stakeholder and business partners to ensure current and emerging needs are addressed.
  • Manage procurement and contracts for one or more vendors and manage complex issues.
  • Formally attend project and program board meetings, prepare reports, advice and recommendations for presentation at more senior governance forums as required.
  • Have and apply a comprehensive knowledge of principles, practices and theories as they relate to effective project management, with particular regard to PRINCE2 methodologies, together with the ability to apply these within ACIC.

requirements.description:
The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is a statutory agency in the Defence portfolio that defends Australia against global threats and advances our national interests through the provision of foreign signals intelligence, cyber security and offensive cyber operations as directed by the Australian Government.  Cyber.gov.au & Digital Systems (CDS) section within Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) is responsible for delivering the enhancement and ongoing support of a variety of capabilities that underpin ACSC’s efforts to “help make Australia the most secure place to connect online.”  This includes the ReportCyber Application Platform (RCAP) that provides a single point of entry for individuals, businesses and government to report cyber-crimes and have their reports referred to the most appropriate responders.  A Senior Web Developer – React Front End is required to support the ongoing development and sustainment of the RCAP, and to meet changing support and service expectations. This role is critical for building new capability or enhancements for ReportCyber as well as sustaining the platform. The ReportCyber project requires a software developer with knowledge of, and experience in, the React Javascript library.

Indicative duties include, but are not limited to:

Strong proficiency in React/TypeScript/Javascript/ES6/Typescript/Webpack/SASS/CSS.

Tracking and progressing tasks to completion within an Agile, Kanban and Scrum framework.

Implementing UX specs to public facing applications. Single-Page Application (SPA) experience including state-management (e.g. Redux, MobX), routing, responsive design etc.

Producing detailed design documentation.

Key knowledge, skills or experience areas include:

Application design for front end in React.

Developing for the Salesforce CRM platform. Knowledge of Apex or Python development.

Experience with Amazon Web Services (including Amplify) would be highly regarded. 

All contracted staff must hold an Australian Government issued security clearance at the level required for the role they are engaged to perform prior to commencement in ASD.

NOTE: This roles requires the successful candidate to complete and Organisational Suitability Assessment (OSA) within 12 months of engagement.

An OSA is an ASD policy requirement (ASD-POL-014) for contractors who will be engaged for a period in excess of 12 months. OSA’s are conducted to determine a person’s suitability to work in ASD. Before submitting an application for this role, the candidate should consider their preparedness for questions that may include the following topics: personal relationships, living circumstances, personal values, financial situation, physical and mental health history including substance use, and any civil and/or military record.

requirements.description:
The Royal Australian Navy Central Canteens Board (RANCCB) t/a The Navy's Anchorage, is a Commonwealth Corporate Entity within the Defence portfolio and reports in accordance with the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013. RANCCB currently uses Xero as its Financial Management Information System (FMIS) and Employment Hero as its payroll/HR system. Xero has been in use since 1 July 2021 where it replaced Attaché which had been in use since 2018. Employment Hero has bee in use since 2020.

During the 2021-22 audit, the Australian National Audit Office (ANAO) determined that both Xero and employment Hero did not fully comply with the Commonwealth Government IT control and audit requirements, and as such RANCCB received a number of audit findings. RANCCB has decided, in part in response to the audit findings, to replace both Xero and Employment Hero with a fit-for-purpose IT system(s). However, due to expected growth of the organisation over the next few years, RANCCB has determined that it is also an opportunity to upgrade systems that will provide management with an enhanced level of analysis and reporting around financial, HR and customer relationship management (CRM) data.

requirements.description:
The ACCC requires services to conduct a number (up to six) penetration tests, each comprising:

  • Testing one, or a combination, of components of the ACCC’s Azure cloud infrastructure, databases, network devices, portal and websites
  • Development of a penetration test plan (in conjunction with the ACCC IT teams)
  • Execution of the agreed plan
  • Report detailing the test results and associated recommendations.


This will involve the following document deliverables to the ACCC for each test:

  • Penetration Test Plan – detailing the agreed test approach and scope. The plan is to specifically address the:
    • Planned sequence of test activities and associated timeframes,
    • Toolsets to be employed (together with any requirement for software to be installed on ACCC or third-party infrastructure),
    • Dependencies (including those relating to ACCC or third-party involvement), and
    • Resource requirements (resourcing as well as any ACCC resources or third-party required to support the testing effort).
  • Penetration Test Report – detailing the results of the planned testing program and including an assessment of these results which addresses:
    • Areas of system tested and not tested;
    • the vulnerabilities identified and the nature and extent of the associated risk, and
    • recommendations for treating the vulnerabilities and risks identified.

requirements.description:
The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission (ACIC) is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Program / Project Manager to support a number of current and upcoming ACIC ICT projects.

The expected roles and responsibilities are to:

  • Lead and manage ICT project(s) or a program of work which contribute to the ACIC’s strategic outcomes and objectives, in accordance with corporate standards for project management and ensure projects integrate with the ACIC’s business.
  • Document and manage the start-up, initiation, delivery and closure of projects in accordance with corporate project management standards, which are based upon PRINCE2.
  • Develop and/or update Business Cases for large and complex ICT projects.
  • Develop and maintain an accurate project schedule and deliver products according to the schedule.
  • Develop and maintain the project budget, and track costs and expenditure to deliver the project within tolerances.
  • Manage scope, quality, risk and issue management processes to ensure outcomes are delivered.
  • Identify, acquire and manage project staff and provide effective direction and leadership to the project team.
  • Engage with an extensive array of stakeholders on any given project. The role is required to initiate, establish and maintain strong relationships with: (1) Internal stakeholders to ensure access to resources and alignment with other interrelated projects; and (2) External stakeholder and business partners to ensure current and emerging needs are addressed.
  • Manage procurement and contracts for one or more vendors and manage complex issues.
  • Formally attend project and program board meetings, prepare reports, advice and recommendations for presentation at more senior governance forums as required.
  • Have and apply a comprehensive knowledge of principles, practices and theories as they relate to effective project management, with particular regard to PRINCE2 methodologies, together with the ability to apply these within ACIC.

requirements.description:
The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is a statutory agency in the Defence portfolio that defends Australia against global threats and advances our national interests through the provision of foreign signals intelligence, cyber security and offensive cyber operations as directed by the Australian Government.  Cyber.gov.au & Digital Systems (CDS) section within Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) is responsible for delivering the enhancement and ongoing support of a variety of capabilities that underpin ACSC’s efforts to “help make Australia the most secure place to connect online.”  This includes the ReportCyber Application Platform (RCAP) that provides a single point of entry for individuals, businesses and government to report cyber-crimes and have their reports referred to the most appropriate responders.  A Senior Web Developer – React Front End is required to support the ongoing development and sustainment of the RCAP, and to meet changing support and service expectations. This role is critical for building new capability or enhancements for ReportCyber as well as sustaining the platform. The ReportCyber project requires a software developer with knowledge of, and experience in, the React Javascript library.

Indicative duties include, but are not limited to:

Strong proficiency in React/TypeScript/Javascript/ES6/Typescript/Webpack/SASS/CSS.

Tracking and progressing tasks to completion within an Agile, Kanban and Scrum framework.

Implementing UX specs to public facing applications. Single-Page Application (SPA) experience including state-management (e.g. Redux, MobX), routing, responsive design etc.

Producing detailed design documentation.

Key knowledge, skills or experience areas include:

Application design for front end in React.

Developing for the Salesforce CRM platform. Knowledge of Apex or Python development.

Experience with Amazon Web Services (including Amplify) would be highly regarded. 

All contracted staff must hold an Australian Government issued security clearance at the level required for the role they are engaged to perform prior to commencement in ASD.

NOTE: This roles requires the successful candidate to complete and Organisational Suitability Assessment (OSA) within 12 months of engagement.

requirements.description:
The Royal Australian Navy Central Canteens Board (RANCCB) t/a The Navy's Anchorage, is a Commonwealth Corporate Entity within the Defence portfolio and reports in accordance with the Public Governance, Performance and Accountability Act 2013. RANCCB currently uses Xero as its Financial Management Information System (FMIS) and Employment Hero as its payroll/HR system. Xero has been in use since 1 July 2021 where it replaced Attaché which had been in use since 2018. Employment Hero has bee in use since 2020.

During the 2021-22 audit, the Australian National Audit Office (ANAO) determined that both Xero and employment Hero did not fully comply with the Commonwealth Government IT control and audit requirements, and as such RANCCB received a number of audit findings. RANCCB has decided, in part in response to the audit findings, to replace both Xero and Employment Hero with a fit-for-purpose IT system(s). However, due to expected growth of the organisation over the next few years, RANCCB has determined that it is also an opportunity to upgrade systems that will provide management with an enhanced level of analysis and reporting around financial, HR and customer relationship management (CRM) data.

requirements.description:
As the Senior Communications Advisor, External Communications, you will lead the delivery of a strategic, planned communications approach that tells the Bureau story to build our reputation as the trusted source of information.

At the heart of this role is strategic communications. You will demonstrate a proven ability to problem-solve and develop communication and issues management strategies underpinned by clear logic, considered thinking and a solid evidence-base. You will deliver a coordinated, consistent and collaborative approach to informing internal and external stakeholders about the Bureau's work.

Working across the Communications Program, you will develop and deliver communications strategies that support the work being undertaken by business area. You will provide strategic communication advice to support operational areas, aligned to priorities. You will develop and coordinate internal and external communication activities across a range of platforms and channels and ensure alignment with the organisation's overall strategic direction.

Our work has a significant impact on the lives of many Australians. This is a role where you will feel like you are making a direct contribution to the Australian community by keeping them informed and engaged about the weather, climate, water and oceans.


Please refer to attached RFQ documents

requirements.description:
The DTA is seeking a Content Designer specialist role in the Architecture and Emerging Technology Branch (A&ET) to assist with the development, documentation and communication of a comprehensive and evolving set of business requirements for a new platform to publish the Australian Government Architecture (AGA). 

The role will be responsible for gathering, documenting and communicating the requirements of the AGA website, and coordinating with the CTO branch to ensure the requirements are implemented in the new version of the product for initial release by 30 June 2023. 

The role is a Content Designer Specialist – preparing visual communications and presentations, including in the documentation of the requirements of the new platform, and in reporting on the status of the work of the team to Senior Executives.

The specialist will work closely with internal and external users to understand and capture user and business needs and identify opportunities for change. They will work with product managers, technical architects and interaction designers to design solutions to complex problems. They will help the product manager make critical decisions by gathering, analysing and presenting information and facilitating collaboration.

The successful candidate will have:

  • Demonstrated experience in solving complex problems based on analysis and investigation for the delivery of software requirements or product owner services,
  • Ability to initiate and deliver new work in short timeframes and to collaborate and work in iterations and continuous delivery cycles,
  • Knowledge of technology areas relevant to the publishing of architecture guidance and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience in data collection, visualisation, documentation and communication.
  • Ability to work with vast and complex datasets and present the visualisations in a simple way.
  • Ability to pull data from various source systems, effectively model and prepare data for visualisation.

Do you enjoy working in a team developing with latest technology whilst also building products that make a difference? Then this job could be for you.

  • You have demonstrated experience developing web applications with modern reactive JavaScript frameworks.
  • You have backend development using web API and SQL technologies.
  • A solid understanding of software development principles using any language or toolset but preferably C#, Vue and TypeScript.
  • Automation of builds, tests and deployments.
  • Independence, motivation and timely production of high-quality work.
  • Solid communication between you and your team.
  • A collaborative, problem solving attitude.

  • Participate in requirements analysis

requirements.description:
Mandatory Requirement

As part of the eligibility and suitability requirement, NDIA seeks specified personnel who are Australian citizens.

Applicable for ACT, VIC and QLD: Labour hire licences are required in the state that specified personnel are being contracted.

The request seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide an ICT Team Lead to support the agency’s Salesforce platform. As an ICT Team Lead, you will be responsible for leading a team of support specialists and managing day-to-day operations of the Salesforce system and the release management process. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify, troubleshoot and resolve Salesforce-related issues and provide continuous improvement to the platform.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage a team of support specialists, providing coaching and support to ensure high-quality service delivery.
  • Manage and co-ordinate the backlog of incidents, bugs, change requests, and system enhancements across the breadth of the Salesforce platform.
  • Execute all required ICT change management activities including creation of high-quality change records and release documentation, coordination of testing activities, sign-offs from various stakeholders and more.
  • Develop and implement support processes and procedures to ensure consistent and efficient resolution of Salesforce-related issues.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on the agency’s Salesforce platform and its business rules, staying up-to-date with new features and functionalities
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize bug fixes, system enhancements and upgrades.
  • Perform operational tasks including access management and provisioning, backup and restore activities, internal reviews, control implementation and service transition activities.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to ensure business objectives are met.
  • Monitor and analyse system health and performance, identifying areas of improvement and implementing solutions, including improving the team’s ability to identify and respond to system issues before end users.
  • Develop various reporting including incident and queue management, team capacity and velocity, problem areas, trends, and business uptake.
  • Develop and maintain user documentation and training materials to ensure user adoption and satisfaction.

requirements.description:
The Office of the Registrar of Indigenous Corporations (ORIC) is seeking the services of a firm to undertake a review of the Investigation and Prosecutions function (IPs).

The review will consider both operational and strategic matters relating to the function, including: the role of prosecutions as part of ORIC’s broader compliance regime; the effectiveness of the current function; and options for the future of the function. The review will include benchmarking of the current function, peer review of identified case studies as well as research on better practice IPs functions in other regulators. The review is expected to identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness of ORIC’s current IPs function, and ultimately contribute to consideration of ORIC’s overall compliance approach. A detailed terms of reference for the engagement is attached.

The review will be outlined in an editable Word report which will specify the work undertaken, findings and any resulting recommendations.

Draft copies of the report are to be provided to ORIC for consideration as key milestones. ORIC will review the report and provide feedback which is to be reflected in the next iteration of the report.

jobs.title: JSA - Consultant - Scan of approaches for forecasting future employment and skills demand
jobs.innerText:
Invited sellers only
JSA - Consultant - Scan of approaches for forecasting future employment and skills demand ID: DM-17871
Department of Education, Skills and Employment
Closing: 10 March 2023, 11:59PM Canberra time
Category: Strategy and Policy
View details

overview.label: RFQ closing date
overview.value: Friday, 10 March 2023 • 11:59pm, Canberra time (or once all sellers have responded)

overview.label: Buyer
overview.value: Department of Education, Skills and Employment

overview.label: Buyer contact
overview.value: No contact details reported. Please direct questions through the 'Question and Answers' portion of the RFQ process.

requirements.description:
Jobs and Skills Australia would like to conduct an initial scan of approaches to forecasting future employment and skills demand, as a input into JSA determining its future approach to producing employment and skills forecasts. The scan would address:

  • What are the existing models in forecasting employment and skills demand undertaken the Commonwealth, State and Territory Governments, training providers, large employers and industry bodies
    • This would involve updating the work commissioned by the interim National Skills Commission in 2019-20. A number of states have updated or modified their approach since that time.
    • The proposal should include provision to engage with the following agencies:
      • Skills Canberra, ACT Government
      • Department of Education, NSW
      • TAFE NSW
      • Department of Jobs, Skills, Industry and Region, VIC
      • Victorian Skills Authority
      • Department of Employment, Small Business and Training (DESBT), QLD
      • Jobs Queensland
      • Department of Training and Workforce Development, WA
      • Department of Industry, Innovation and Science, SA
      • South Australian Skills Commission
      • Department of Industry, Tourism and Trade, NT
      • Skills Tasmania, Department of State Growth, TAS
    • What are the required specifications that a set of forecasts produced by JSA would require?
      • This would capture elements such as the form of the model outputs (e.g. persons, occupations, qualifications), the level of detail, the forecast period, and the flexibility to produce results based on different scenarios
      • This would involve gathering input from JSA executive and critical stakeholders including DEWR and Treasury as well as drawing on (1)
    • What are the current products available in the market to support employment and skills demand forecasting in the Australian labour market?
      • For example, this could involve looking at CGE models available in the Australian market and assessing their suitability against JSA’s specifications.
    • What would be the considerations in building a model inhouse?

The scan will provide JSA with a concise map of existing employment and skills forecasts in Australia and a draft set of specifications and options to support decision-making for future JSA employment and skills forecasts.

jobs.innerText:
Open to all
Land Combat System (LCS) Battle Lab Systems Engineer ID: DM-17872
Department of Defence
Closing: 31 March 2023, 11:59PM Canberra time
Category: ICT Labour Hire
View details

overview.label: Buyer contact
overview.value: No contact details reported. Please direct questions through the 'Question and Answers' portion of the RFQ process.

requirements.description:
The Commonwealth seeks to engage an Advanced Practitioner as the Land Combat System (LCS) Systems Engineer to assist with management of the LCS Battle Lab (LCSBL), and more specifically support risk reduction and Introduction into Service of the Land 200 Tranche 2 network. The role will also be required to support L200-1 and L200-3, as there will be a transition period between the tranches. This RFQTS is for an established vacant position in the LCSBL within the Land Network Integration Centre (LNIC).

The LCSBL facility provides a lab environment to conduct ‘system of system’ and scale testing of the Tactical Communications Network (TCN) in order to inform capability decisions, support in-service capability and assist in the evaluation of candidate technologies. The TCN includes multiple radio bearer systems (i.e. EPLRS, AN/PRC-152 and 158 radios), Waveforms (SINCGARS, VULOS, ANW2) and the battle management system applications including the BMS Command and Control (BMSC2) and Fires (AFATDS) systems.

The contractor will be expected to act in a technical hands-on role, with responsibility as the subject matter expert lead for software design & applications as well as middleware & routing for the L200 TCN and BMS. The contractor will also assist with LCSBL system administration and test tool development, which will require the key person to have programming aptitude. It is envisaged that the contractor will also become a subject matter expert for L200 integration into the Generic Vehicle Architecture (GVA) and Generic Soldier Architecture (GSA). 

A three (3) month period of probation is imposed as a condition of engagement for all new contractors.

data.label: Working arrangements
data.value: It is expected that the majority of services delivered under this contract will be at the LNIC facility in Symonston, ACT. Interstate travel, and possibly international travel, will be required to support TCN trials, liaison with LNBL stakeholders and the support of other ADF field activities. These events will be forecasted by LNIC, booked by the vendor and reimbursed by the Commonwealth.

requirements.description:
The Commonwealth requires the services of an ICT Procurement Support Officer to supplement the contractor workforce within the Land Network Integration Centre (LNIC). This proposal seeks to engage an ICT Procurement Support Officer - Advanced Practitioner to assist with supporting and accurately administering ICT procurement activities within the organisation. This includes drafting and preparing procurement document packs and obtaining necessary approvals in accordance with Departmental procurement policy and legislation; liaising with relevant staff and Defence procurement stakeholders, to efficiently and cooperatively progress procurement activities; maintaining an overview of concurrent procurement activities and appropriately forecasting and prioritising work effort.  

The ICT Procurement Support Officer will be expected to undertake simple and complex ICT procurement activities to support the deliverables and projects in a manner that is compliant with Commonwealth Procurement Rules (CPRs), Defence Instructions and Land Capability Division Business Rules. The ICT Procurement Support Officer will be confident with task coordination, communication and maintaining ‘dashboards’ or similar artefacts to support briefing, decision making and record keeping. This includes ensuring staff have appropriate information and defensible audit records regarding current and historic procurement activities.

The contract is for one year for a maximum of 40 days in FY22/23 and 190 days in FY23/24 for the term of the contract. Two additional one year extensions, out to a maximum of three years, may be considered based on Commonwealth requirements and funding availability.

A three (3) month probation period will be imposed as a condition of employment for all new contractors.

Prior applicants should not reapply.
